meanings.definition: A small, herbivorous mammal native to Africa, resembling a rabbit with short ears and a tail.
meanings.sent1: The hyraces nibbled on the green leaves in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of hyraces hopping around in the grassland.
meanings.sent3: The hyraces decided to have a dance party under the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The hyraces' agility in finding food is like a well-trained athlete.
meanings.sent5: The children were delighted to see the hyraces playing in the zoo enclosure.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'hyrax', referring to multiple individuals of the species.
meanings.sent1: The hyraces gathered near the rocks to sunbathe together.
meanings.sent2: We observed a family of hyraces climbing the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent3: The hyraces held a meeting to discuss the best grazing spots.
meanings.sent4: In the distance, the hyraces looked like a moving carpet of fur.
meanings.sent5: The tourists were amazed by the sight of the hyraces basking in the sun.
